oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FULLY ABSTRACT SEMANTICS FOR HIGHER-ORDER COMMUNICATING SYSTEMS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAMESH, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper is concerned with semantic theories of higher order communicating systems (HOCS). In these higher order systems, processes exchange processes themselves. In this paper, we present two semantic theories, a behavioral theory and a denotational semantics for a slight variant of Thomsen's Higher Order Calculus. The proposed behavioral theory is based upon the theory of testing due to de Nicola and Hennessy. The semantic model is a higher order extension of Hennessy's acceptance tree model and is shown to be fully abstract with respect to the testing pre-order.
